components.description:
A pig, a plump animal farmed for its meat, such as bacon. Depicted in light pink in full profile on all fours facing left, with a long snout and short, curly tail.

May be used to represent the animal, its food products, or various metaphorical senses of pig.

One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac; 2019 is the Year of the Pig. See also üê∑ Pig Face, üêΩ Pig Nose, and üêó Boar.

WhatsApp’s design previously featured a wide grin.

title: Pig

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A domestic pig, whose ancestor is the wild boar. This farm animal has been created in a photorealistic style in Apple‚Äôs artwork, and cartoon http://emojipedia.org/pig/
emoji_net_data.name: pig

bn:00091155v: Utter a high-pitched cry, characteristic of pigs

bn:00073025n: Sus scrofa domestica or Sus domestica
The domestic pig, often called swine or hog, is a large, even-toed ungulate; it is variously considered a subspecies of the wild boar, or a distinct species.

bn:00007847n: Cured meat from the sides, belly or back of a pig.
Back and sides of a hog salted and dried or smoked; usually sliced thin and fried
Bacon is a meat product prepared from a pig and usually cured.
Bacon is a cured meat prepared from a pig.
The flesh of the back and sides of a pig, salted and dried, used as food.

bn:00042006n: Any of several mammalian species of the genus Sus, having cloven hooves, bristles and a nose adapted for digging; especially the domesticated farm animal Sus scrofa.
Animals in the genus Sus, within the Suidae family of even-toed ungulates
Pigs are ungulates native to Eurasia collectively grouped under the genus Sus within the Suidae family.
Sus scrofa domestica or Sus domestica
The domestic pig, often called swine or hog, is a large, even-toed ungulate; it is variously considered a subspecies of the wild boar, or a distinct species.
A common, four-legged animal (Sus scrofa) that has cloven hooves, bristles and a nose adapted for digging and is farmed by humans for its meat.
Any animal belonging to the Suidae family of mammals, especially the pig, the warthog, and the boar.
A pig is any of the animals in the genus Sus, within the Suidae family of even-toed ungulates.
